message:
SYSTEM: OWL.pdf: Página 38
Property Restrictions
A restriction describes an anonymous class (an unnamed class). The anonymous
class contains all of the individuals that satisfy the restriction (i.e. all of the
individuals that have the relationships required to be a member of the class).
Restrictions are used in OWL class descriptions to specify anonymous superclasses of the
p
p
y
y
p
class being described.
Existential restrictions describe classes of individuals that participate in at least
one relationship along a specified property to individuals that are members of a
specified class.
For example, “the class of individuals that have at least one (some) hasTopping
relationship to members of MozzarellaTopping”.
Universal restrictions describe classes of individuals that for a given property
© O. Corcho, MC Suárez de Figueroa Baonza
75
OWL and SWRL
Universal restrictions describe classes of individuals that for a given property
only have relationships along this property to individuals that are members of a
specified class.
For example, “the class of individuals that only have hasTopping relationships to
members of VegetableTopping”.
Existential Restrictions (I)
An existential restriction describes a class of individuals that have
at least one (some) relationship along a specified property to an
individual that is a member of a specified class.
Existential restrictions are also known as Some Restrictions or as some values from
Existential restrictions are also known as Some Restrictions, or as some values from
restrictions.
